text: this silky rich chocolate mousse pie
with a fellow crust is sure to be a
crowd pleaser I'm just starting with a 9
inch cake pan that I've buttered and I
have laid two strips of parchment this
is going to make it much easier to
remove the pie once it's done now for
the phyllo I have large sheets of phyllo
and phyllo always needs to be covered or
it will dry out so I have it under a
towel take one sheet and then brush with
melted butter this is a stick of melted
butter which should be plenty to do all
the phyllo these sheets are very
delicate so just go carefully okay now
two to three tablespoons of sugars about
all you need sprinkle it over half of
the sheet just a light sprinkle to cover
and then fold one half over the other
and then buddy the top this goes into
the pan buttered side down just fit it
right into the pan and you want about a
half inch top this is going to be the
crust so you want a little edge to the
side on to the next sheet
I'm just going to keep working around
the pan making an edge
this is going to go into a 350-degree
oven get nice and golden-brown and we'll
take about 20 minutes okay this is our
beautifully baked filo crust nice and
golden-brown it's been cooling for about
10 minutes and I have three and a half
ounces of melted semi-sweet chocolate
I'm going to brush the bottom and about
one inch up on the sides there's many
layers here so don't worry if it
shatters a bit they'll stay in the pan
this is going to go into the fridge
after this and it will all set okay now
to make our luscious chocolate mousse
filling starts with a bowl set over a
pan of simmering water this is the basic
double boiler setup I'm going to put in
four large egg yolks a quarter cup of
sugar and a quarter teaspoon of salt Oh
a salt just to balance flavors this kus
whisk together and we just want to heat
this until the sugar starts to melt
don't want to scramble the eggs the best
way to know if your sugar is dissolved
is to just feel it and rub it between
your fingers shouldn't feel any granules
then you know the sugar is melted now
I'm going to add the chocolate three and
a half ounces of bittersweet chocolate
just want this to melt make sure this is
nice and smooth
now we'll remove from the heat and let
this cool for about ten minutes
I have one cup of unsweetened whipped
cream I'm going to put about a third of
it in here and just whisk it to combine
this will lighten the base and then we
can fold in the rest okay that's good
now add the rest and then a larger
spatula to fold it gently in
this is our chilled shell the chocolate
is set this will go right inside this
goes back into the refrigerator for
about three hours to set that mousse
this is our great set hi the chocolate
is nice and firm so I'm just going to
remove it from the pan just pull on
these strips and it should just kind of
pop right out let's get it onto a cake
stand okay now for our whipped cream I
have another cup of heavy cream
this time sweetened with sugar just
going to dollop it on top okay now you
can add some chocolate shavings here
just a peeler and a block of chocolate
and just grate this right over the top
and you'll get some pretty little shards
so let's slice into it and see what it
looks like
this pie is such a treat
